description: DB: creating a bundle sets `master_ticket_id` on children and creates a `ticket_bundle_settings` row.
DB: mirrored bundle comments are marked `is_system_generated` and are immutable via API.
Invariant: cannot add a ticket to two bundles (already bundled error).
Invariant: cannot create cycles by promoting/adding tickets that would create an ancestor loop.
Security: bundling rejects cross-tenant ticket ids (same-tenant only).
Permissions: user without required ticket update permissions cannot bundle/add/remove/promote/unbundle.
UI: ticket list toggle switches between bundled and individual modes and persists preference.
UI: bundled view shows only masters/standalone and displays child count for masters.
Search: in bundled view, searching for a child returns the master in results.
Filters: status/priority/board/client filters behave correctly in bundled view and individual view.
UI: individual view groups children under master (when both appear in the page).
UI: bulk select 2+ tickets enables Bundle Tickets modal with master selection and sync toggle.
Actions: add child by ticket number adds the child to the bundle and updates the master panel list.
Actions: remove child unlinks the child and keeps the rest of the bundle intact.
Actions: unbundle master detaches all children and removes bundle settings.
Actions: promote child to master repoints all children to the new master and migrates settings.
UI: child ticket shows a banner linking to the master ticket.
Locking: child workflow controls are disabled in UI and rejected on server updates.
Bundling keeps child status unchanged immediately after bundling.
Conversation: inbound child replies appear on master as view-only aggregated items without creating a master comment row.
Sync updates: updating master status/assignment/priority propagates to all children when mode is sync_updates.
Sync updates: closing the master propagates closure fields to children when mode is sync_updates.
Sync updates: public master comment mirrors to children as immutable, system-generated comment; internal notes do not mirror.
Time: creating a time entry on a bundled child is blocked; master time entry succeeds.
Email: public master comment sends fanout emails to all child requesters with correct threading and portal links; dedupe by email.
Multi-client: bundles can include children across different clients within the same tenant (no rejection).
Reopen policy: if enabled, inbound child reply reopens master (and does not create duplicate notifications).
